creator: syedmohd.b@sonata-software.com
text:
I have tried Apache 2.0.40 on Redhat 9.0 (installed by rpm package from 
redhat). Apache web server hangs, when i hit the web server multiple times 
simultaneously. This behaviour does not happen with source verison (i have 
downloaded source code of 2.0.40 and build on RH 9.0).

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Please open a problem with RedHat. (I'm sure they would want you to be running
their latest RPM update so grab the latest and recreate if possible and be sure
to tell them exactly which of their 2.0.40 Apache builds you're using.)

If you can find how to duplicate the problem with an unmodified current release
of Apache (e.g., 2.0.47), please re-open this PR with the details.

Thanks for using Apache, wherever you may have gotten it :)
another minor point: the PR summary says "2.0.45" but PR text says "2.0.40"
creator: trawick@apache.org
syedmohd.b@sonata-software.com
text: Thanks. It is 2.0.40. I informed this problem to RedHat guys.
